resources.string: London, capital of England and the United Kingdom, is a 21st century city with a history that dates back to the Roman era.
Santorini is one of the Cycladic islands in the Haggai Sea. It was devastated by a volcanic eruption in the 16th century BC, forever shaping its undulating landscape.
Rome, the capital of Italy, is a huge, cosmopolitan city with almost 3,000 years of globally influential art, architecture and culture on display.
San Carlos de Bariloche (commonly called Bariloche) is a city in the Argentine Patagonia region.
Orlando is a city located in the US state of Florida, in Orange County, of which it is the headquarters
Cancún, a Mexican city located on the Yucatán Peninsula, on the coast of the Caribbean Sea, is known for its beaches, its various resorts and its nightlife.
Dubai is a city and emirate in the United Arab Emirates known for its luxury shopping malls, ultramodern architecture and lively nightlife.
Punta Cana, a region that corresponds to the extreme east of the Dominican Republic, is bathed by the Caribbean Sea and the Atlantic Ocean.
Amsterdam is the capital of the Netherlands, known for its artistic heritage, an elaborate system of canals and narrow houses with gabled roofs, legacies of the citys 17th-century golden age.
Venice, the capital of the Veneto region in northern Italy, is made up of more than 100 small islands in a lagoon in the Adriatic Sea.
